Unlocking monsters, do DVD regions matter?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): CD Topics: Unlocking monsters, do DVD regions matter?
By Pablo Castillo on Thursday, October 25, 2001 - 07:35 pm:

I presupose that all DVD's listed on these website are region 1, but I don't know if region 4 CD's can regenerate the same monsters, do they?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, October 25, 2001 - 07:43 pm:

They will probably differ. We even have problems with pressing withing region 1 making different monsters. Some region 1 copies of Gladiator make a Plant, some make a Durahan. Since even a fraction of a second can make a big difference on the chart of what the game reads, don't count on DVDs from other regions to match the listed monsters.

Also, on page 3 of the game manual is a warning to not use discs that the PS2 was not designed to play. I suspect that non-North American region discs will either lock the system up, or make the standard Mocchi.

By Barronbrad on Thursday, October 25, 2001 - 09:54 pm:

huh?

By Lisa Shock on Friday, October 26, 2001 - 12:01 am:

I thought he was asking if a copy of a DVD film made for another region would make the same monster as that movie in our list. For example, a copy of Blade Runner for us makes the rare Fay. However, the copies sold in Asia might not, because the pressing might be off by a few seconds (basic subcode research in the lab on differences in pressings) or the disc might have extras on it, or parts removed, like commercials for different regions.

By Barronbrad on Friday, October 26, 2001 - 10:34 am:

oh

By Pablo Castillo on Monday, October 29, 2001 - 08:39 pm:

thanks lisa, sort of depressing to know this, but you got the exact answer to my question
